subject: Marketing
title: Fear as a Motivator
description: A quick win: understand Fear as a Motivator.

hook.text: Anti-smoking ads with diseased lungs cut smoking rates more than any rational argument.

buildup.text: Fear grabs attention like nothing else. It bypasses logic and triggers immediate action.

discovery.text: Fear appeals work best when paired with a clear, achievable solution.

twist.text: Too much fear backfires. People shut down, deny the threat, or ignore the message.

climax.text: The sweet spot is enough fear to motivate, plus enough hope to act.

quiz.question: When do fear-based marketing appeals work best?
options: When paired with a clear and achievable solution
When the fear is as extreme as possible
When no solution is offered at all
